body_html:
Looks like you're adding a declaration for some higher level template but not for an implementation. The demangled error: tensorflow::functor::ScatterNdFunctor<Eigen::GpuDevice, int, int, (tensorflow::scatter_nd_op::UpdateOp)0, 6>::operator()(Eigen::GpuDevice const&, int, Eigen::array<long, 6ul>, Eigen::TensorMap<Eigen::Tensor<int, 2, 1, long>, 16, Eigen::MakePointer>, Eigen::TensorMap<Eigen::Tensor<int const, 2, 1, long>, 16, Eigen::MakePointer>, Eigen::TensorMap<Eigen::Tensor<int const, 2, 1, long>, 16, Eigen::MakePointer>, Eigen::TensorMap<Eigen::Tensor<int, 2, 1, long>, 16, Eigen::MakePointer>) Perhaps you forgot to remove a TF_call somewhere? Here it looks like you still have a TF_call for int type on GPU. You removed it somewhere in the impl but not in the declaration.
…
On Mon, Jan 29, 2018 at 12:04 PM, Robin Richtsfeld ***@***.*** > wrote: We're getting this weird error all over the place: ImportError: /tmpfs/tmp/bazel/execroot/org_tensorflow/bazel-out/k8-py3- opt/bin/tensorflow/examples/adding_an_op/cuda_op_test. runfiles/org_tensorflow/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow_internal.so: undefined symbol: _ZN10tensorflow7functor16Scatte rNdFunctorIN5Eigen9GpuDeviceEiiLNS_13scatter_nd_ op8UpdateOpE0ELi6EEclERKS3_iNS2_5arrayIlLm6EEENS2_9TensorMapINS2_ 6TensorIiLi2ELi1ElEELi16ENS2_11MakePointerEEENSB_INSC_ IKiLi2ELi1ElEELi16ESE_EESI_SF_ The last part looks somewhat like tensorflow functor ScatterNdFunctor Eigen GpuDevice scatter_nd_op UpdateOp array TensorMap Tensor MakePointer — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#16368 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABtim2SbHb3zuntkbTIgozyNwC6_5ji9ks5tPiRlgaJpZM4Rrbx3> .
body_text:
Looks like you're adding a declaration for some higher level template but
not for an implementation.  The demangled error:

tensorflow::functor::ScatterNdFunctor<Eigen::GpuDevice, int, int,
(tensorflow::scatter_nd_op::UpdateOp)0, 6>::operator()(Eigen::GpuDevice
const&, int, Eigen::array<long, 6ul>, Eigen::TensorMap<Eigen::Tensor<int,
2, 1, long>, 16, Eigen::MakePointer>, Eigen::TensorMap<Eigen::Tensor<int
const, 2, 1, long>, 16, Eigen::MakePointer>,
Eigen::TensorMap<Eigen::Tensor<int const, 2, 1, long>, 16,
Eigen::MakePointer>, Eigen::TensorMap<Eigen::Tensor<int, 2, 1, long>, 16,
Eigen::MakePointer>)

Perhaps you forgot to remove a TF_call somewhere?  Here it looks like you
still have a TF_call for int type on GPU.  You removed it somewhere in the
impl but not in the declaration.
…

body:
Looks like you're adding a declaration for some higher level template but
not for an implementation.  The demangled error:

tensorflow::functor::ScatterNdFunctor<Eigen::GpuDevice, int, int,
(tensorflow::scatter_nd_op::UpdateOp)0, 6>::operator()(Eigen::GpuDevice
const&, int, Eigen::array<long, 6ul>, Eigen::TensorMap<Eigen::Tensor<int,
2, 1, long>, 16, Eigen::MakePointer>, Eigen::TensorMap<Eigen::Tensor<int
const, 2, 1, long>, 16, Eigen::MakePointer>,
Eigen::TensorMap<Eigen::Tensor<int const, 2, 1, long>, 16,
Eigen::MakePointer>, Eigen::TensorMap<Eigen::Tensor<int, 2, 1, long>, 16,
Eigen::MakePointer>)

Perhaps you forgot to remove a TF_call somewhere?  Here it looks like you
still have a TF_call for int type on GPU.  You removed it somewhere in the
impl but not in the declaration.

> wrote:

> The last part looks somewhat like tensorflow functor ScatterNdFunctor
